intro: Buddleja salicina, commonly known as the silver-leaf buddleja, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white down. The plant produces fragrant, clustered spikes of purple to pink flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract butterflies and bees. Buddleja salicina is relatively low maintenance and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
